mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: New Purpose House is a nonprofit organization in Houston, TX, committed to transforming lives by providing safe housing, structure, and hope for women rebuilding after incarceration or substance abuse. We are more than a program — we are a community where women from all walks of life are given the tools, guidance, and support to heal, rediscover their purpose, and step confidently into a new chapter of independence and stability. The primary objective of New Purpose House is to offer a safe, nurturing, and holistic program that addresses the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of personal growth and self-sufficiency. We aim to foster a community where women can support each other in their journey to personal development, ultimately helping them to find purpose and become productive members of society.

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.content: New Purpose Recovery House stands out due to its holistic approach to recovery, combining evidence-based practices with personalized care. Our focus on empowering women through education, life skills training, and community support ensures a comprehensive and sustainable recovery process that helps women find their purpose and re-enter society as productive individuals.

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: Building Communities Through Compassion and Action

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: New Purpose House is dedicated to breaking cycles of poverty and inequality through education, mentorship, and direct support services. We work hand-in-hand with community members to identify needs and create sustainable solutions.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: We envision a world where every individual has access to the resources, opportunities, and support they need to thrive. Through collaborative efforts and unwavering commitment, we strive to create lasting positive change in every community we serve.

story.title: Our Story
story.content: Founded in 2010, New Purpose House began as a small grassroots initiative to provide after-school tutoring to underserved youth. Over the past 15 years, we've grown into a comprehensive nonprofit serving thousands of families through education programs, job training, mental health services, and emergency assistance. Our growth has been guided by one principle: listen to the community and respond with dignity, respect, and meaningful action.

programs.title: Offered Services
programs.subtitle: Comprehensive Support for Every Stage of Life
programs.intro: We offer a wide range of programs designed to address the diverse needs of our community members. Each program is carefully crafted with input from those we serve.

items.title: Residential Recovery Program
items.description: A structured living environment with 24/7 support to ensure stability and safety.

items.title: Counseling and Therapy
items.description: Individual and group therapy sessions led by licensed professionals to address underlying challenges and develop effective coping strategies.

items.title: Life Skills Training
items.description: Workshops and classes focusing on skills such as financial management, job readiness, and personal development to help women become self-sufficient.

items.title: Peer Support Groups
items.description: Activities and resources to promote physical health, including fitness classes, nutritional guidance, and mindfulness practices.

items.title: Health and Wellness Programs
items.description: Dedicated courses to support mothers in building parenting skills and fostering positive family relationships.

items.title: Parenting Classes
items.description: A program aimed at equipping women with the skills and resources needed for workforce reintegration. This includes job training, resume-building workshops, interview preparation, and partnerships with local employers for job placements.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: We're Here to Help
faq.intro: Have questions? We've compiled answers to the most common inquiries. If you don't see your question here, please contact us directly.

items.question: Who is eligible for your programs?
items.answer: Our programs are open to all community members regardless of income, background, or circumstances. Some programs may have specific eligibility criteria based on funding requirements, but we work to ensure everyone who needs support can access our services.

items.question: How do I apply for services?
items.answer: You can apply by visiting our office during business hours, calling our main line, or submitting an application through our Apply Now page. Our intake coordinators will guide you through the process and help you access the services you need.

items.question: Is there a cost for services?
items.answer: Most of our services are completely free. Some programs may have a sliding scale fee based on ability to pay, but no one is ever turned away due to inability to pay.

items.question: How can I volunteer?
items.answer: We welcome volunteers! Visit our Contact page to express your interest, and our volunteer coordinator will reach out to discuss opportunities that match your skills and availability. We provide training and ongoing support for all volunteers.

items.question: Are donations tax-deductible?
items.answer: Yes! New Purpose House is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. All donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent allowed by law. You will receive a receipt for your records.

items.question: How do you ensure my privacy?
items.answer: We take privacy seriously. All personal information is kept confidential and secure. We comply with all relevant privacy laws and never share your information without your explicit consent, except as required by law.

items.question: What areas do you serve?
items.answer: We primarily serve residents of [Your City/County], but some programs are available to neighboring communities. Contact us to learn if you're within our service area.

items.question: How is the organization funded?
items.answer: We're funded through a combination of individual donations, corporate partnerships, foundation grants, and government contracts. We maintain transparency through our annual reports, which are available on our website.
